basics.name: Priyam Sahoo
basics.label: CS graduate student
basics.summary: Graduate Research Student at UIUC, working on specification synthesis, code reasoning, and math/logic-guided LLMs. Past experience in building domain-specific code generation and language tooling for large-scale developer systems. Motivated to solve problems at the intersection of programming languages, AI, and formal verification.

work.name: PL/FM/SE Group, University of Illinois Urbana Champaign
work.summary: Developing neural techniques to generate formal specifications from informal natural language descriptions by capturing user intent to specify the functional correctness of programs.

work.name: Team wisdom, Red Hat Inc.
work.summary: Worked on developing Ansible Lightspeed Service with IBM WatsonX Code Assistance, a highly domain-specific LLM-based solution for natural language to ansible-YAML code generation.

work.name: Ansible Engineering Team, Red Hat Inc.
work.summary: Developed Ansible Language Server and its VSCode extension that offers decentralized language support for Ansible language with features such as syntax highlighting, diagnostics, auto-completion and hovering, functionalities in code editors.

work.name: Artificial Intelligence and Robotics (AIR) Lab, VIT and NVIDIA
work.summary: Developed an Arduino-driven prosthetic arm with 2 degrees-of-freedom wrist and independent finger movements, equipped with a palm-mounted camera for detecting objects and executing autonomous gripping maneuvers.

work.name: Reconfigurable Intelligent Systems Engineering (RISE) Lab, IIT Madras
work.summary: Contributed to Open Malware Research by developing a real-world dataset for malware behavioral analysis considering network, OS, and hardware trails for detecting malware.

publications.name: Ansible Lightspeed: A Code Generation Service for IT Automation
publications.summary: Designed Ansible Lightspeed, an LLM assistant for the Ansible DSL, and conducted the first large-scale DSL code-completion study with 10,696 users, analyzing edit behavior, usage, and sentiment. Introduced the Strong Acceptance metric (49.08% on multi-line tasks) and reported 13.66% day-30 retention, showing the value of domain-tuned models; released the service and evaluation framework.

publications.name: Vision enabled Smart Prosthetic Arm for Amputees
publications.summary: Built an Arduino prosthetic arm with a palm camera and a two-degree-of-freedom wrist that detects objects and auto-selects grips using YOLOv3/GR-ConvNet; recorded grip demos with Leap Motion and IR sensors via Johnny-Five. Reached 94.6% grasp success across five strategies with independent finger, force, and position control.

publications.name: Comparative Empirical Analysis of Some Computational Algorithms using Different Programming Languages
publications.summary: Poster presentation on Empirical Analysis of Algorithms by benchmarking 11 classic algorithms in C++, Java, and Python (1,000-run averages; Valgrind Massif) to compare runtime and memory; C++ led both, and Python generally beat Java except on OBST.

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
